ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with reference cases 1 and 2, sharing all major phenotypes including hypsarrhythmia, infantile spasms, severe intellectual disability, autism, EEG abnormalities, hypotonia, and CNS hypomyelination.

Strong match with reference case 3, sharing hypsarrhythmia, infantile spasms, severe intellectual disability, autism, EEG abnormalities, and hypotonia. CNS myelination delay in reference aligns with patient's hypomyelination.
Classic triad of infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia, and developmental delay/intellectual disability are present. Often associated with autism and hypotonia.
KCNQ2-related disorder can present with infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia, severe intellectual disability, and hypotonia. EEG abnormalities are common.
SCN8A-related disorder can present with infantile spasms, intellectual disability, hypotonia, and autism spectrum disorder. Hypsarrhythmia is less common but possible.
Can present with infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia, intellectual disability, autism, and white matter abnormalities that could manifest as hypomyelination.
Similar to TSC1, can present with infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia, intellectual disability, autism, and white matter changes.
ARX-related disorder can present with infantile spasms, hypsarrhythmia, severe intellectual disability, and hypotonia. Autism features are possible.
